intro: Calyptranthes oneillii, commonly known as O'Neill's calyptranthes, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and clove. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and elliptical leaves with a glossy surface. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as mesic forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
